column4: hmm i wonder what this means ? : Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!

without context, it's hard to say what it means. but generally speaking, a man-in-the-middle attack is when you're transfering information with someone else, and there is an unwanted third party "in the middle" that has access to the transmission channel.
aurel42 im just working on my ssh server it tells me someone might be doing something nasty and i should change some file...but how can i change the file without ssh access :P
the server you're connecting to has probably changed its fingerprint for some reason - can you think of any valid reason?
